alert.note: Alert for Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Georgetown, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Mount Orab, Sardinia, Hamersville, Mowrystown, Feesburg, Greenbush, New Hope, Locust Ridge, Buford and Lake Waynoka. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
